page.title:
Severe-Habitual/Long-Standing Problems When chronic misbehavior does not stem from a student’s lack of awareness or ability, and is not being exhibited because the student wants attention, then you need to assume that the behavior is now habitual/long standing and is serving some other purpose for the student.
Severe-Habitual/Long-Standing
Problems

page.title:
Awareness Type Misbehaviors
Awareness Type Misbehaviors
page.normal_text:
For ongoing misbehavior that stem from students’ lack of awareness of when/how much they are misbehaving, be prepared to develop and implement an intervention plan that includes increasing their awareness of their behavior.
For ongoing misbehavior that stem from
students’ lack of awareness of when/how
much they are misbehaving, be prepared
to develop and implement an intervention
plan that includes increasing their
awareness of their behavior.

Power/Revenge Problems

page.title:
Final Details

page.enlisting:
(Four Minutes) • Evaluate: Identify at least two ways to determine if the plan is working. • Support: Identify things other adults can do to assist the student and teacher. • Plan Summary: Identify each person’s responsibilities and when actions will be taken. Identify who will discuss the plan with the student.
